message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper focuses on pre-training algorithms for hierarchical document representations, which are often used in natural language processing tasks such as summarization, segmentation, and sentiment analysis. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper proposes algorithms for pre-training hierarchical document representations from unlabeled data, which involves learning representations of text and integrating contextual information from entire documents. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV), which are all relevant to the development of algorithms for learning representations of text and integrating contextual information.
